004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.math.trajectory.TrapezoidProfile.State;
008import static edu.wpi.first.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
009
010import edu.wpi.first.math.controller.ProfiledPIDController;
011import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
012import java.util.function.DoubleSupplier;
013import java.util.function.Supplier;
014
015/**
016 * A command that controls an output with a {@link ProfiledPIDController}. Runs forever by default -
017 * to add exit conditions and/or other behavior, subclass this class. The controller calculation and
018 * output are performed synchronously in the command's execute() method.
019 *
020 * <p>This class is provided by the NewCommands VendorDep
021 */
022public class ProfiledPIDCommand extends Command {
023  /** Profiled PID controller. */
024  protected final ProfiledPIDController m_controller;
025
026  /** Measurement getter. */
027  protected DoubleSupplier m_measurement;
028
029  /** Goal getter. */
030  protected Supplier<State> m_goal;
031
032  /** Profiled PID controller output consumer. */
033  protected BiConsumer<Double, State> m_useOutput;
034
035  /**
036   * Creates a new PIDCommand, which controls the given output with a ProfiledPIDController. Goal
037   * velocity is specified.
038   *
039   * @param controller the controller that controls the output.
040   * @param measurementSource the measurement of the process variable
041   * @param goalSource the controller's goal
042   * @param useOutput the controller's output
043   * @param requirements the subsystems required by this command
044   */
045  @SuppressWarnings("this-escape")
046  public ProfiledPIDCommand(
047      ProfiledPIDController controller,
048      DoubleSupplier measurementSource,
049      Supplier<State> goalSource,
050      BiConsumer<Double, State> useOutput,
051      Subsystem... requirements) {
052    requireNonNullParam(controller, "controller", "ProfiledPIDCommand");
053    requireNonNullParam(measurementSource, "measurementSource", "ProfiledPIDCommand");
054    requireNonNullParam(goalSource, "goalSource", "ProfiledPIDCommand");
055    requireNonNullParam(useOutput, "useOutput", "ProfiledPIDCommand");
056
057    m_controller = controller;
058    m_useOutput = useOutput;
059    m_measurement = measurementSource;
060    m_goal = goalSource;
061    addRequirements(requirements);
062  }
063
064  /**
065   * Creates a new PIDCommand, which controls the given output with a ProfiledPIDController. Goal
066   * velocity is implicitly zero.
067   *
068   * @param controller the controller that controls the output.
069   * @param measurementSource the measurement of the process variable
070   * @param goalSource the controller's goal
071   * @param useOutput the controller's output
072   * @param requirements the subsystems required by this command
073   */
074  @SuppressWarnings("this-escape")
075  public ProfiledPIDCommand(
076      ProfiledPIDController controller,
077      DoubleSupplier measurementSource,
078      DoubleSupplier goalSource,
079      BiConsumer<Double, State> useOutput,
080      Subsystem... requirements) {
081    requireNonNullParam(controller, "controller", "SynchronousPIDCommand");
082    requireNonNullParam(measurementSource, "measurementSource", "SynchronousPIDCommand");
083    requireNonNullParam(goalSource, "goalSource", "SynchronousPIDCommand");
084    requireNonNullParam(useOutput, "useOutput", "SynchronousPIDCommand");
085
086    m_controller = controller;
087    m_useOutput = useOutput;
088    m_measurement = measurementSource;
089    m_goal = () -> new State(goalSource.getAsDouble(), 0);
090    addRequirements(requirements);
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Creates a new PIDCommand, which controls the given output with a ProfiledPIDController. Goal
095   * velocity is specified.
096   *
097   * @param controller the controller that controls the output.
098   * @param measurementSource the measurement of the process variable
099   * @param goal the controller's goal
100   * @param useOutput the controller's output
101   * @param requirements the subsystems required by this command
102   */
103  public ProfiledPIDCommand(
104      ProfiledPIDController controller,
105      DoubleSupplier measurementSource,
106      State goal,
107      BiConsumer<Double, State> useOutput,
108      Subsystem... requirements) {
109    this(controller, measurementSource, () -> goal, useOutput, requirements);
110  }
111
112  /**
113   * Creates a new PIDCommand, which controls the given output with a ProfiledPIDController. Goal
114   * velocity is implicitly zero.
115   *
116   * @param controller the controller that controls the output.
117   * @param measurementSource the measurement of the process variable
118   * @param goal the controller's goal
119   * @param useOutput the controller's output
120   * @param requirements the subsystems required by this command
121   */
122  public ProfiledPIDCommand(
123      ProfiledPIDController controller,
124      DoubleSupplier measurementSource,
125      double goal,
126      BiConsumer<Double, State> useOutput,
127      Subsystem... requirements) {
128    this(controller, measurementSource, () -> goal, useOutput, requirements);
129  }
130
131  @Override
132  public void initialize() {
133    m_controller.reset(m_measurement.getAsDouble());
134  }
135
136  @Override
137  public void execute() {
138    m_useOutput.accept(
139        m_controller.calculate(m_measurement.getAsDouble(), m_goal.get()),
140        m_controller.getSetpoint());
141  }
142
143  @Override
144  public void end(boolean interrupted) {
145    m_useOutput.accept(0.0, new State());
146  }
147
148  /**
149   * Returns the ProfiledPIDController used by the command.
150   *
151   * @return The ProfiledPIDController
152   */
153  public ProfiledPIDController getController() {
154    return m_controller;
155  }
156}
